alert.note: Alert for Edgefield; McCormick (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 23 at 11:16AM EST until January 24 at 5:30PM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in South Carolina... Stevens Creek Near Modoc affecting Edgefield and McCormick Counties. .Heavy rainfall with amounts from 2 to 3 inches across the Stevens Creek basin continues to produce minor flooding. The river crested early this morning at 21.30 feet. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Stevens Creek Near Modoc. * WHEN...Until late this afternoon into early tonight. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Farmland along Stevens Creek above the US Highway 23 bridge near Modoc becomes flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM EST Monday the stage was 20.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this afternoon and continue falling to 3.9 feet Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and take action if necessary. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1115 PM EST.
